content.content: Project name: Optimistic Ape Yacht Club Author name and contact info: https://twitter.com/sol_snowman I understand that I will be required to provide additional KYC information to the Optimism Foundation to receive this grant: Yes L2 recipient address: 0x81B7E9d8409B857D70aD14073E785c486945CaF4 Which Voting Cycle are you applying for?: Phase 1 Grant category: NFT Is this proposal applicable to a specific committee? Yes Project description: OAYC is the fastest growing NFT community on the Optimism blockchain. Top-6 all-time trading volume in only 1 month. Today OAYC has passed phases 1 to 3. The ecosystem consists of 2 NFT collections, weekly replenished community assets, DAO, and strong community. OAYC’s own discord DAO bot will be launched soon. In next few month OAYC will enter the phase 4. Ecosystem will include a lot of ecosystem sub-products. Such as educational platform for beginners in NFT, marketing platform for new Optimism projects, research lab, merch store and other. Project links:  Website: https://oayc.io/  Twitter: https://twitter.com/OptiApeYC  Discord: https://discord.gg/oayc   Additional team member info (please link): Founder – https://twitter.com/sol_snowman Artist – https://twitter.com/papasweeds Community lead – https://twitter.com/web3daem Art director – https://twitter.com/paulcownick Relevant usage metrics:  17K twitter followers ~8K discord members 600+ ETH trading volume 0.05 ETH floor price (x6 from the mint price) 1.1 ETH ATH sale 3x times in top3 trending globally on OpenSea  Competitors, peers, or similar projects (please link): https://qx.app/collection/optimists https://qx.app/collection/optichads https://qx.app/collection/oporcas https://qx.app/collection/optipunks Is/will this project be open sourced? Yes Optimism native?: Yes Date of deployment/expected deployment on Optimism: October 15th, 2022 Ecosystem Value Proposition: We did a great job for the Optimism NFT community by launching mint only for OP token and sold it out less then in 24h. We attract a lot of new members from other chains as well. Our goal is to make OP NFT market to another level by providing a top-tier community space, utilities and ecosystem products. We will become not only an NFT collection but a space where new minters and builders can get knowledge, exposure, connections and other support. This will make Optimism NFT more easy to enter and more attractive comparing to other L2. This funding opportunity is a way to support the whole OP NFT community as OAYC is on of the most active and valuable projects of the ecosystem. Incentivizes will be used not only to support current community but to attract new users from other chains as well. Number of OP tokens requested: 100,000 $OP Did the project apply for or receive OP tokens through the Foundation Partner Fund?: No Proposal for token distribution: 60% – Staking pool Concept: We will use OP rewards to create staking pool and provide rewards for these holders who lock their NFT in stacking contract. Maintain the $OP NFT ecosystem alive and live, attracts a new buyer and liquidity to the ecosystem. Terms: 1 month to launch KPI: decrease listings (<6%) and attract new buyers and liquidity. 40% – Community missions rewards Concept: We will motivate community to complete missions and receive OP rewards. This will help us to promote OAYC itself and OP NFT market in general. Typical missions: content sharing, testing, participation in votings, etc Terms: 1 month to launch KPI: 30 000+ twitter followers, +500 unique holders Please provide any additional information that will facilitate accountability: NFT contract: https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0x0deaAc29d8A3d4EbBAAa3eCd3cC97C9deF00f720 Opense link: https://opensea.io/collection/optiapeyachtclub

The proposal includes information about the project, its ecosystem, usage metrics, competitors, and token distribution. The author is explaining the proposal and providing details about the project, while a 3rd party is giving entirely positive feedback and extending to the proposal by offering funding. Another 3rd party is asking questions about the proposal.

But on the other hand, it shows you the strength of the community and the desire to make the project successful. And community support is one of the main points in evaluating the potential of NFTs. We are not going to spam such calls in support of the proposal further. But at the same time, we don’t see anything wrong with showing community support.

content.content: Sorry, we missed your attempts to contact our team. We remember your messages on our mint day but the team didn’t get a chance to start a conversation as the mint day is a very busy day. We reached you out on Twitter several times btw and had no response too  Please open a ticket in discord or dm us on Twitter so we can finally talk. Regarding previous initiatives, OAYC has launched dozens of community giveaways and marketing campaigns to bring more people to the Optimism NFT and keep the current community active. It helped us to reach almost 500 ETH trading volume in 2 months and +2000% ATH floor price. We need some time to sum up the number, examples, and performance of these initiatives. And we have already made a forecast of the results that can be expected from the use of this grant in the future. You can find it in the proposal.

content.content: Unfortunately this does not provide the analytic data that was requested and this info needs to displayed with actual metrics as well as a clear thought out distribution schedule. I don’t see a distribution schedule in the proposal. Opensea statistics are not enough to qualify the project for a grant. I am hearing concerns from other members within the community about the most recent mint from the Oayc project and whether the funds from minting the project are involved with any retroactive donations. I am curious as well to hear if there has been any contributions to the Optimism ecosystem since the launch of the project. Approximately 80,000 more OP tokens were just collected from a secondary mint so I am not sure why more assistance with funding is needed if that is the case. Please provide any data using DUNE analytics from the project that can help show the other members of the governance the statistics of the previous mints, the way the original mint funds were used for public goods, or any initiatives led by the project team in a clear & transparent manner.

content.content: Optimism network is not so strong in term of NFT space rn. The ecosystem needs projects as OAYC to stay and develop. We need additional funding to add more utility and make secondary more active. Our last sold out is a good basement to keep developing and promoting the project. But is is not even close enough to launch staking pool and community rewards. This is why we made this proposal. If community wants OP NFT market to grow, then projects as OAYC must be supported. We made people to come to OP network and buy ~200 000 OP tokens, isn’t it the value for the ecosystem? There are not so many strong communities on OP. And OAYC is one of them. If we had this funding, we will make community better and OP NFT space stronger.

Once again you have not provided the information that was requested in the form of dune analytics charts that help represent the OAYC track record history on the blockchain. You are not showing the OP governance the proper information to help support this grant at the moment and help reassure members of the community that the funds will be distributed in a proper well thought out manner that is displayed in the token distribution schedule of the grant proposal. Please remember that it was also asked that you stop having members who are not involved with the OP governance delegation process to stop comments here. They continue to interrupt the forum which was intended as a place for a valuable conversation based around the presentation of the grant with other delegate members. It is great that your project did well in sales but that is not enough info to approve this proposal. Also in the last sentence you mentioned that if you had the funding you, “ will make community better and OP NFT space stronger. “ What happened to the original funding of the project and how was that not possible with over 180,000 OP tokens raised in the past 4 months of your project ??? Something does not seem right about a project which raised such a high amount of OP token for their project and at the same time they are not able to submit the proper information necessary for a grant proposal. Especially when asked numerous times after hearing concerns from other community members within the OP NFT space. Now the ask is 100,000 tokens but with zero data on track history from the project treasury. At this time I can not support this proposal with the lack of metrics provided and will ask once again to have members of your community please refrain from using this forum as some sort of social media platform to try promoting your project.

content.content: Derivative NFT projects very rarely hold value or community long term. I think original projects and ideas are better suited for grants.

content.content: I agree there are a lot of red flags here along with the lack of any metric data provided. My main concern is that the funds from the grant might become misappropriated if the recipient is not fully understanding the grant process. So far we have not seen any significant data showing any of the track record history from the original mint of the project or how the funds were used to help grow the ecosystem. Once again this team has made over 200,000 OP in the mint of their project and does not have a way to show the community how the OP tokens were used after the initial mint. For instance… Are these tokens still in the possession of the project? I will continue to suggest against approval of any grant proposals that do not respond to the questions of the governance here on the forum with proper communication and documentation.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving entirely negative feedback on proposal

content.content: Why does it look like this thread was botted with likes and comments? Looks very sketchy

As you can see here there was a social media post driving traffic to the forums and if you continue on reading you will see in the forum where I asked kindly to not have their users directed here. The request was ignored as well as any additional information that was requested about the metrics and track record of the project to help show members of the governance why the project should be considered for a grant. If the applicants do not understand the code of conduct on the governance forums and do not respect the request of other governance committee members by ignoring them and continue to do so then the chances of receiving funding are much less likely. I suggest to keep any community members commentary separate from the forums unless they themselves are a delegate of Optimism governance and have something valuable to add to the conversation such as statistical data or facts about the project and it’s current standings.     MinimalGravitas:  Please can you not brigade threads like this. There is no benefit to encouraging your followers to spam comments here that do not discuss the specifics of a proposal.
